ARABIC: فَإِذَا ٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتْ وَرْدَةً كَٱلدِّهَانِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When heaven is split apart and goes red like dregs of oil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When the sky will split asunder, and turn rosy like the dregs of annointing oil,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (What will happen) when the heaven will be split asunder and will become crimson like leather?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (On the Day of Judgment) when the heavens are rent asunder they will have a flowery color and flow like oil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And when the heaven will split, it will appear like a rose painted red.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then when the heaven is rent asunder, and it becomes Wardah like Dihan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And when the heaven is rent asunder, and then becomes red like red hide.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And when heaven is split asunder, and turns crimson like red leather --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And when the heaven splitteth asunder and becometh rosy like red hide -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: When the sky is rent asunder, and becomes red like red leather,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And when the heaven will be rent in sunder and will become rosy like Unto red hide.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When the sky is split open, and turns crimson like tanned leather.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: When the sky is rent asunder, and it becomes red like ointment:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then when the heaven is rent asunder, and it becomes rosy or red like red-oil, or red hide.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: When the heaven splits asunder and turns crimson, like red leather.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: When the sky splits apart, and becomes rose, like paint.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And when the heaven is split open and becomes rose-colored like oil -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [55:37] And when the heaven is split open, when it becomes open with [many] gates [in preparation] for the descent of the angels, and it turns crimson (wardatan, [literally, ‘a rose’], in other words, red like this [rose]), like tanned leather, red skins, in contrast to its [the heaven’s] usual appearance (the response to idhā, ‘when’, is [along the lines of] fa-mā a‘zama’l-hawli, ‘How great will be the terror then!’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And when the heaven splitteth asunder) because of the descent of the angels and awe towards the Lord (and becometh rosy) and become coloured (like red hide) like different kinds of paint; and it is said: like the different colours of roses; and it is also said: red in black 635
